# Assembling your Elements 

You will ensure that your data and plotting scripts needed for creating your plot are used to build the up-to-date version of the plot.

## Code Block for Sourcing Your Scripts

```{r}
df_all <- readRDS("/Users/jamis/Desktop/DataViz/cps-167-2025/processed/df_all_cps.rds")

library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
## The Modified Plot
unemploy <- df_all |>
  group_by(race) |>
  summarize(avg_duration = mean(dur_unemp, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = race, y = avg_duration, fill = race)) +
  geom_col(alpha = 0.8) +
  labs(
    title = "Average Unemployment Duration by Race",
    x = "Race",
    y = "Average Duration (weeks)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 13) +
  theme(
    legend.position = "none",
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 25, hjust = 1)
  ) +
  annotate("segment",
           x= -inf, xend=Inf,
           y=16,yend=16,
           color = "red", linewidth = 1)
  

save_plot_png(
  plot = unemploy,
  filename = "race and vet umemployment status",
  figs_dir = here::here("figs"),
  size = 4
)

```
